intro: Arnebia obovata, commonly known as the Indian madder, is a flowering plant native to parts of Asia, including India and China. It belongs to the family Geraniaceae and is characterized by its upright, branched stems and clusters of small, pinkish-red flowers. The plant produces distinctive, obovate-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. It is known for its medicinal properties and has been used traditionally in herbal remedies. Arnebia obovata is also valued for its root, which contains pigments used in natural dyes.
